This place can be hit or miss, but for the most part, it's a hit  - I frequent it about once every two weeks, and I've only been disappointed with the fish quality once or twice.

But the reason I felt compelled to write this review - the other day I ordered their tamago chirashi (a bowl of sushi rice topped with various types of cholesterol-laden "tamago" (egg) - masago (flying fish roe), wasabi masago, ikura (salmon roe), slices of tamago and uni). The uni was some of the best uni I have had. Ever. Buttery, rich, velvety on the tongue, and not at all briny. Who knew you could get such good uni at a fast food sushi joint?!
author: Deb I.

description:
This is an awesome lunch spot - a Japanese restaurant owned by Koreans.  How typical! lol
But it was really good! I got the Tonkatsu bento box which came with rice, soup, salad, oranges and a large serving of crisp and fresh hot Tonkatsu laid on a bed of lettuce.  mmm it was just what the doctor ordered!  
I grew up loving Tonkatsu, and the first bite of today's lunch took me back to the carefree childhood days.  
Price was okay ($8.50) and the service was good.  
Would definitely go here again!
author: James C.

description:
The people are friendly.

The prices are good.

The place can get very crowded at lunch.

The sushi is okay.

The tonkatsu is less than okay.
author: Jon N.

description: After coming back from Japan, it's hard to find the same quality food, but this place satisfies my craving for Japanese food. The udon is good and their maki rolls are good even though you will never find anything like the dynamite or dragon roll in real Japan. Good place to grab some fast food during lunch time.
author: Linda C.

description: I had the unagi, golden gate roll, and double salmon roll. I actually enjoyed them all and the prices are pretty great! The rolls don't always look tooo pretty, but the taste is great and the place was super busy around lunch time.
author: Shavanna C.

description:
So everyone's right about this place...this is not "AUTHENTIC" Japanese food...more like fast food in taste, smell, and overall quality.  But hey for $7 bucks, I get a hot meal.  

chicken donbori is my favorite....steamed veggies, topped with a fried egg and served with rice and chicken.  Sides are a small salad and miso soup OR get a side of Edammae

Fast, No Fuss and meets my expectations each time.  

What do you want for this price? Gourmet?  Get it for what its worth...
author: Alice H.

description:
I blame Tokyo Express and their cheerful employees who used to call me by name when I called in my order, for the 10 pounds I gained while working in the FiDIi

My weekday lunch order always  went something like this:
Ring, Ring, Ring
Them: Tokyo Express
me: Uh, yeah I'd like to order something to go..chick...
Them: (interrupting) Cynthia? 
Me:(sheepishly) yeah, it's me
Them:  Hi Cynthia! Chicken Udon and Sparkling water? it'll be ready in 20 minutes.

They are too efficient, to nice, and their noodles are too yum.

DAMN YOU TOKYO EXPRESS!!!!
author: cynthia a.

description:
I pick up food here for myself and my coworkers all the time.  They have the food all ready to go in 10 minutes.  They are speedy, polite, and the food tastes great.
I like that lunch orders come with miso soup and a salad.  The favorite at the office is the chicken teriyaki bento that has a slab of cut up teriyaki marinated chicken, huge portion of rice, and con come with tempura upon request.  My coworker raves about the beef donburi which is beef over a rice bowl.
They have daily lunch specials.  Today I got the California Roll special which had at least 8-10 rolls for $7.99 plus miso soup and salad.  I am not a huge sushi fan, so I don't know why I ordered it, but it was good with the pickled ginger and wasabi, and after I was full.
My experiences here have been good, and I would recommend it as a good fidi reasonably priced lunch spot.
author: Light Bulb J.

description: Had an unagi donburi, which wasn't exactly a traditional donburi (not that I expected it to be). It had slices of avocado and it had a fried egg. Actually not bad, but not amazing either (yeah, I use that a lot here). Came with soup and salad. And was not cheap--for a work lunch anyway.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Popped into Tokyo Express today to get some sushi to go.  Ordered the "Sushi B Special": one California roll, 5 pieces of sashimi (salmon, eel, two types of tuna, and shrimp), miso, and salad.  
For $7.99 thank you very much.
And it was FAST.  Freakishly fast--I swear to God they were handing me my to-go bag in less than 60 seconds.  The kind of fast made me pretty sure I walked away with someone else's Sushi B.  
Or maybe they're just that good.  
In any event, it's a solid go-to and speedy sushi spot for lunch.
author: Auburn D.

description: This place has been here forever.  Their bento boxes are really good - order a teriyaki, add a couple of bucks for tempura and there, you have a bento box!  It gets really crowded, so you should either have an early or a late lunch.  You order at the counter, find a table and then they take the food to your table.
author: Jay S.

description:
I give them a 3 star review only because their prices are the BEST... I have eaten here a few times now (its right behind my office).  the food is normally "OK".  and even Good when you consider the price. 

In any event, today I was monumentally disappointed.  Forget that the guy working the take out counter gave me the wrong order and I had to walk back to exchange it for my order...  But the "Katsu don" was the most disappointing dish I have ever had... calling it Katsu don" is a stretch.  it was: White rice + plain steamed vegetables + katsu + fried egg +3x tiny packets of tonkatsu sauce..... How is that considered katsu don?  LoL
author: ken n.

description: Rolls were pretty dry, but unagi donburi was a hit. perfect portions for a mid-sized eater. sushi platter looked good but didn't try. love the do it yourself tea with mini to-go cups.
author: Deb B.

description: Gets busy at lunch.  Best to go early to beat the hordes.  Sushi is ok - not amazing - reasonably priced for lunch.  Will satisfy sushi fix but not transport you.  Wish there were more combo lunches offered.
author: Kim S.

description: love it love it love it!! this is my all time favorite sushi joint!! i love their veggie tempura roll.. service is SUPER FRIENDLY and the decor is very lovely!! adds to the whole experience this place does!.. presentation of the sushi is exqusite! Menu has pictures all over the place so no guess work.. gets busy at lunchtimes but is open till later than most others (like 3pm i think, i don't know, call them tho).. i love this place! we used to go there at lunchtimes, but then i moved work - i miss you guys terribly!
author: Rak P.

description: I don't come here that often, but I was very satisfied with their Thursday special of a Shogun roll (Crab, Avocado & Cucumber, Eel & Tobiko on Top) and 3 spicy tuna rolls with miso soup and salad for $10 plus tax.  In these tough economic times, it's not as crowded as it used to be which makes it a little more pleasant than before; there is some benefit to the plummeting of the world financial markets.  In the past, I've gotten the bento box combos which are also good, but the ones that include sushi are a bit too much food for lunch, I find.  Nice lunch spot.
author: Marc S.

description:
SF Food Inspection Score: 3 stars

I love coming to the Financial District for lunch. They have PERFECTED the lunch rush.

The service was very nice and timely. 

The seafood udon was very well done, good broth, lots of veggies and seafood.

Because it's far from where I work and live, I won't be frequenting it a lot, but when I'm around, I'll definitely think of it...
author: Kristina C.

description:
My new favorite light lunch destination!  I have found that one cucumber roll and one spicy California roll make the perfect light lunch.  I've tried this a couple of times and have found everything to be very fresh.  

Good idea to call ahead, though, as the plass is ass to elbows c-r-o-w-d-e-d!  Eww.
author: Daryl E.

description: Your typical Japanese restaurant.  Quality is poor to mediocre and sushi is described as "mall sushi".  They cater too but be prepared to pay for a delivery fee and deal with abrupt service when ordering over the phone.  I ceased ordering party sushi trays from here and recommend Miyabi restaurant on Church st. instead for your catering needs.  They will deliver to the Fidi.  Look for my review on catering needs.
author: Carmina B.

description:
This is an absolutely great place to get lunch during the workday. You can get in and out quickly, so there are no worries about exceeding your lunch hour, and they are relatively cheap, so it is affordable to go there somewhat regularly. I think I usually spend about $12 on lunch, getting either sushi, chirashi, or a bento box. It is crowded most of the time, but if you have a couple people ordering, you just send the first person to wait for a table and by the time the last person is finished ordering, you have a table.
Tokyo Express is nothing amazing in the way of quality or service, but I don't expect much at lunchtime, and I still get to go back to work with a sushi high.
author: Cyrelle D.

description:
Ever been in the financial district and said to yourself "i'm in the mood for sushi". Unfortantely it's Lunch hour, there's no seating in any restaurant ANYWHERE, and you're gonna settle for just quick sushi to-go? Then this is your restaurant.

Granted at times they do have seating, most of the people who come here are going to order "out". The prices are pretty good given the location, and the food comes relatively quick. I used to come here all the time when I worked next to the Pyramid. The bento boxes were awesome. Oh lo' how I miss this place at times.

The food doesn't "wow" anyone, but take it for what it really is. Quick sushi to go.
author: Clinton L.

description: Tokyo express wins on convenience.  I think it is the best sushi place in its price range that is a quick walk from the financial district.  Finding a seat can be a problem at lunch time as the place gets packed.  Their beer and wine is reasonably priced.  A good place for some quick sushi.
author: Derek n.

description: I'm a big fan of teriyaki so when i saw this place right behind my new job i got a little excited. the teriyaki chicken was delicious and I also tried the dragon roll (my favorite shushi roll) which was exceptional as well i've eatin here a couple times and will be back.
author: Pedro L.

description:
Best Chicken Udon I've had so far.  It's the perfect combination of savory (broth), chewy (fresh noodles), and smoky (chicken).  

A great place to grab a quick bento or sushi combo for less than $10, but nothing is as satisfying as their udon ($6.50) on a chilly day.
author: Nancy G.

description: I ordered the chicken teriyaki bento box to go.  I think i got a good deal they give me alot of chicken, but the temperu wasn't crunchy maybe i should of took it out of the box sooner instead of three hours later.   I ordered it by phone before 4:00pm on a Thursday and took it to work to eat it.  I pick it up after 4:00pm.  They had no minimum on the credit card I think.
author: John F.

description:
I've been here at the cusp of lunch hour, and right on the dot, all y'all come rolling in, like a Black Friday sale gone bad. The place becomes jam-packed within a matter of minutes, and stays that way till 1:30 or so. The staff are experienced in dealing with this insanity, and have never messed up my order. Everyone seems to bring one or more buddies from the office, which is probably why it fills up so fast.

I prefer to spend my "sushi money" on really good sushi at dinner, so I've never bought sushi here. Some of my buddies from the office (see above) have succumbed. If you do this, you're gonna fork over probably $20 and end up with a smallish lunch of pretty basic fish.

However, if you want a more standard Japanese lunch, they'll do ya right. For the past 6 months, I have purchased nothing but the unagi donburi ($10 exactly with tax). I just don't get bored with it! Also, their tempura is usually good and lumpy, though I'm sure it comes from a mix.

Orders are delivered rapidly. They've got a small army working in the kitchen. The food is good quality, fresh, and consistent. The place is clean, though the men's bathroom is a bit gross. (Guys, what's the deal with that soap dispenser bottle that's been there for over a year?)

The left side of the restaurant is full of little 2- and 4-person tables, and the right side has little booths with a fake roof that everyone is always fighting over, because hey, little booths!

The secret to avoiding the lunch-hour insanity here is to call in your order. (The front desk people will drop everything they're doing to answer the phone... AWESOME.) Then, walk on down, march to the front counter, and collect your meal. The downside is that you won't get to sit in one of the little booths.
author: Asa D.

description: Bento boxes are a good value considering it's in FiDi.  The Salmon teriyaki was really good.  The sushi is decent.  Get in before 12 to beat the rush if you can
author: Ashu G.

description:
I'm laughing so hard about the other reviewer commenting on TO GO or FOR HERE????  Even after you answer she'll ask again!

One day this place is good.  The next it's so so.  I've gone there a dozen times and I won't miss it if I never go again.  It's decent, but to be honest, I only go there b/c it's so close to work and options are few.
author: Sparkely K.

description: My favorite lunch place in the city.  The sushi melts like butter.  So fresh, so good.  The sashimi is probably the best economical sashimi in the city.  The people that work there are SO nice, even when it is crazy busy.  And this place is crazy busy.  But no matter how long the line is, you ALWAYS get a place to sit because the people who work there know how to get people in and out.  I recommend getting the sushi combo plates and DEFINITELY get Jumping Tail roll (for a fried roll - cheap!!) and Dynamite roll (for a spicy one).  The rolls rule.
author: Priya R.

description:
Tokyo Express
Your Sushi is really good
I would marry you

Now that I got my haiku over, lets get down to business. Tokyo Express may sound like a place that rushes to get food out the door but it is far from that. They take your order, you stand near the registers, wait for your number to be ordered, and enjoy! I have been to Tokyo Express a couple of times before, and everytime I go there, I order a Bento Box with Tempura. The food is really good and the employees there are pretty nice (serving with a smile). If I had a choice for lunch today...I'm probably going to choose you Tokyo Express.

Will you Marry me and make me Bentos till we part ways in death?
author: Michael L.

description: This place is right around the corner from the office.  Definitely alright, particularly given the price.  No, it's not gourmet, but it's fast, filling, and cheap, so I am not going to complain.  The waiters even pressured some people to get the hell out to free up tables while we were waiting.  Which is just awesome.  Will be back, if for no other reason than the convenience of it all.
author: Adam T.

description:
I love this place! One of my all time favorite places to go for lunch. I come with a bunch of friends so we can order more sushi and have more choices to chose from. My faves: Double Punch, Jumping Tail, Salmon Sashimi, and Spider Roll. 

The wait staff are super friendly. Probably not your best bet to come exactly at noon, since the seating can be a little chaotic. 

Note: Make sure you order/pay first and then get a table or they might take your table away. :(
author: Jenny W.

description: This is not gourmet sushi by any means. Everything I had here was pretty mediocre, but it came off the assembly line in record time. I don't see myself becoming a regular here, but if I got a craving for sushi and I'm slammed for time, this is where I'll end up.
author: Jordan M.

description: This is definitely one of the better bang-for-your-buck places around the financial district. The food is consistent, well-priced, and you get enough to save some for dinner if you're that kind of eater. The chicken teriyaki bento is my favorite. While the sushi isn't the best quality around, it gets the job done for a solid lunch.
author: Jenn V.

description:
I go here for the lunch specials at least once a week. The rolls are consistently very good, although maybe a bit on the small size for the price. The Heaven roll in particular is great - rather spicy and always yummi.

The miso soup that comes with the special is decent (I am a great fan of miso soup) and the salad is just some iceberg lettuce with pink dressing - nothing special, but always fresh.

The service is very good, and even if you do not call in your order, you will rarely wait more than 5 minutes for your food.
author: Martin K.

description:
pretty darn good sushi for a financial district spot.  they're friendly and quick on top of that.  the rock & roll is good.  as are the seaweed salad (wakame salad), edamame, gyoza (sometimes), dynamite roll, and more and more.

i used to eat here at least once a week, until i noticed i started coming more than once a week, so i said, maybe i'll just go when i need to go to the tailor next door, so that'll help control my frequency.  except i stopped going to the tailor and then totally forgot that tokyo express was an option.  but now i'm back!
author: spiff e.

description: Seriously, Gag me with a Spoon.  This place is disgusting.  I forgot how much I hated it until I decided to give it another try today.  Probably the grossest sushi experience of my life.  Now i HAVE to go to Tokyo Go Go tonight to clear my pallet of this taste.  NASTY.
author: Claire C.

description: I eat here probably once a week. Good lunch specials and it always turns out pretty good. Ive had the chirachi bowls and salmon bentos. Sometimes the tempura is a little lame, but with the amount of that stuff they crack out during lunch rush, I would expect that.
author: Alex W.

description: Tokyo Express has 17 vegetarian sushi rolls on the menu!! That's a lot of choice for us vegans trapped in the FiDi at lunch time. I tried the crunchy tofu and the cucumber avocado. Both were just as tasty as any pricey/fancy restaurant. Take that with a grain of salt though b/c veggie sushi is a lot harder to screw up than fish.
author: Cindy R.

description: My rating should be a 3.5 but since I'm not allowed....i'll rate on the higher end of the spectrum. I wanted sushi so I head out to Tokyo Express by the suggestion of my co-worker... and was delighted. I was told the place was small which it is and leaving work around 12:30 I was sure we would hit the lunch crowd. Nope, the place was busy but expremely fast; hence the word "express." The price was reasonably cheap and the food was very tasty. The chicken and salmon bento boxes were great. The salad dressing was tangy and the miso soup (which i'm not a fan of, was actually tasty) The rolls were fresh and were again served up really fast. I would totally come here for sushi again. Thanks for reading, Silvia
author: Silvia S.

description:
i discovered the tempura don quite by accident at the newest sister location of tokyo express @ stonestown - overwhelmed by the vast menu offerings and pressured by the folks waiting in line behind me, i ordered the tempura don simply because i couldn't find tempura  under the bento section.  having never ordered "don" before, i was pleasantly surprised to find a fried egg, savory seaweed salad and a tempura-like sauce covering my rice - i was hooked.

fast forward to last week when i was craving tempura don during the workday and remembered the original tokyo express i used to frequent in the fidi.  i quickly called in an order and hurried over.  once i got back to my office, i was surprised yet again upon opening the food container - but this time not so pleasantly.

where's my wakame salad?  instead, there were chunks of carrots and zucchini - some mushy, some barely cooked.  just not the same.
and the sauce tasted different.  but most importantly, where was the tempura?!?!?  at stonestown, i usually get 2 pieces of shrimp, 2 pieces of sweet yam (my fave!), and 1-2 pieces of broccoli, carrot and/or eggplant.  fidi's a bit stingier - 2 pieces of shrimp and 1 piece each of yam, carrot and broccoli.  wtf?!

the beef teriyaki isn't as good as i remember it to be either.  boo...if i didn't have stonestown to compare it to, maybe 3 stars but otherwise, i'll get my tempura don fix elsewhere.
author: Jen P.

description: Firstly, all of the lunch places in the Financial District are relatively pricey. This place offers good and fast service. Their fish Bento  Box was surprisingly good and not dry. It gets crowded and tough to find a seat before 1, but I've been there at least 5 times over the past year, and it hasn't let me down yet.
author: De F.

description:
Very good tasting sushi. The cost is ok depending on how much you eat. I spend about $13-15 to get full and I can eat a good amount of sushi. 

Service - They are quick but can get very busy during lunch time. It is advised to call in your order 15 mins in advance and then pick up to minimize the wait time.
author: Andrew F.

description: Great lunch spot.  Surprisingly fresh fish and nice rolls for a take-out joint.  I love their unagi don - they make it the right way, complete with fried egg, yellow turnip and avocado.  They're also hyper-efficient if you call it in, too.   Plus its cheaper than Kamakura any day.
author: Serena Y.

description: It's not Anzu, or even Ebisu, but it's good for what it is: fast, cheap lunch food. i think part of the reason it is decent is they do a very high volume: all the fish is always fresh. their sister restaurant is Sushi Rika on Bush, BTW.
author: Erica W.

description:
Not very good.  I had the sushi special.  It was pretty weak.  Nothing tasted very good.  But I didn't get sick and it wasn't really bad either, so I can't give them just one star.

Steps to improvement: better fish, smaller menu, don't precut the fish, and keep it cold until served, not luke-warm.  And I don't care if they would have to increase the price to make that possible.
author: Jeff W.

description: Went for the first time today for a late lunch.  They had a brisk business which is usually a good sign.  My friends ordered regular rolls to go and received them very quickly.  I ordered two deep fried rolls and a seaweed salad.  The staff asked me if I knew the rolls were deep fried and I said yes.  Then we had to wait a very very long time while other people were ordering and receiving their orders left and right.  I assumed the delay was because the deep frying took a long time and that was why they had asked.  However, when I finally received my order, both of the rolls were over fried.  It seems they had just forgotten them in the fryer and then packaged them up and given them to me anyway.  So the outside was slightly burnt and the fish was overdone, as if it were from Denny's. It was bad.  The seaweed salad was no worse than one gets at most Japanese places in town.  Do not get any fried items here!  Can't speak for the unfried rolls but why would I return when there are sushi shops on every corner?
author: Sonic H.

description: They are super fast and efficient.  food is okay, but the pricing are cheap.  They have this special where you get 3 pieces of spicy tuna and 1 roll and it's only 9.99.  You cannot beat that price in FiDi.  I would go back if I was craving cheap sushi, and at that price, I don't expect it to be spectacularly good.  And it comes w/ miso soup and a very petite salad.
author: AhLin C.

description: I work right across the street. And whenever our boss was in town from Seattle, we would order in from Tokyo Express and pick up the food in about 15 minutes. They are extremely effective, at the point of seeming brisk...but it works for the type of service and food they offer. Speaking of the food, the sushi is surprisingly good for a place that's right on the border between FiDi and Chinatown. No real complaints, really. So why the 3 stars? Well...it's all a bit too fast paced and too rushed. I mean, it's all ok if I'm ordering out, but when I sit down for a meal, I don't generally like to feel the wait and bus staff breathing down my neck. The other patrons are worse; they're like vultures waiting to jump on my not-yet-but-soon-to-be-vacated seat.
author: Philip W.

description: Yummy chicken teriyaki bento, SUPER yummy miso soup, and overall a very good value for the money. It's been a long time since I felt okay spending $8 for lunch in the Financial District. This is definitely worth it!
author: Jenna K.

description: Sushi is great here. Their miso has TONS of tofu in it. I've gone for lunch a LOT, and if you're lucky enough to snag a table (this place is PACKED), sit down. Cause taking it to go takes entirely too long. Nigori is great and the bento boxes at lunch are fabulous!
author: Nicole S.

description: Went back again...just wanted to reiterate, it is A-OK. If you are craving sushi, there really aren't that many other places in the financial district, and this certainly isn't the worst place you can go to.
author: Donald R.

description:
i dont noe about other companies, but at my office our lunch is about an hour long... and theres no way in hell u can come in, order, wait for food, wait for a table, and eat all in that hour... this place was wayyyy crowded!! 

i grabbed a to-go menu with me so the next time i eat here we can call/fax it in and actually have time to eat the food.

maybe it was cuz i took it to-go, but the chicken was really really well done, and kinda burnt!  and the salad was a little watery... but b/c they are so cheap for sushi (averaging about $6/roll) it gets an extra star!  but i'm still glad my boss pays for lunch.
author: Tina L.

description: What is it that makes it so packed at lunch? Is it the bento box lunch specials? The dragon rolls? Decent food, but I've had better. Stick to the sushi though...the last time I got some meat (can't remember if it was chicken or salmon) over rice, it was a little rubbery. Fast, friendly service.
author: N B.

description:
they weren't kidding when they said express. this place gets you in and out like gangbusters. because the place was crowded, it was hard to hear the cashier and i had to have her repeat "tempura" like 50 times before i understood her. once my order was down, it was easy to find a place to sit and wait (only momentarily) for the food. 
i had the beef terriyaki bento box which was just ok. the beef was hardly sliced so i had a difficult time with the whole chopsticks to mouth thing. the beef also tasted slightly.... fishy which disturbed me. the tempura was lukewarm and the tempura dipping liquid was kinda weird. it was an ok place to get some ok japanese food in a really short amount of time. perhaps there are other japanese places in the fidi to explore before i trudge back to this one.
author: Aly L.

description:
my friend trisha and i would meet up here for lunch quite often.  they're fast, friendly, cheap and their menu is pretty extensive.  sometimes it's hard to get a table, but people don't linger so there's usually not a long wait.  i usually some nigiri and roll combo, so i can't vouch for the kitchen food.

my other friend jane claims she ordered udon once and it was filled with little bugs...but i wasn't there and i don't usually try to judge on other people's experiences.  but fyi.
author: Reina M.

description: Yes, i know it is not good sushi. It is not good udon. Nothing of their menu is quality. But i keep going back for my lunch. I am tired of chinese foods, sandwitchs and expensive medioca foods. Sometimes, its a confort to eat something similar to Japanese food for daily lunch.
author: Mika G.

description: Very good food for what at first glance is just a fast-food place. I go there once a month at least. Good value...
author: Michael W.

description: I've only tried the chicken don here, but I like it so far!  It's an affordable and fast lunch spot right in the financial district.  The lunches come with a soup and salad, plus you get free green tea.  Plus, while it's busy, they always have tables available so you can eat a quick sit-down meal.
author: Robyn F.

description: Gets super crowded with the financial lunch crowd.  Good for what it is - japanese fast food.  They get the orders in/out fast.  Price is ok, but big portions (teriyaki bentos).  California roll has too much mayo and all the fried stuff taste a little over fried or greasy, but good for the fast japanese food fix.
author: s z.

description: My office gets take out from here sometimes and I've dined in on a few occasions as well. Try the seaweed salad - it's really delicious.
author: Sydney L.

description: It could be that I ate a few bites at the disgusting Thai place next door before coming here that brought the rating of this place up. Really it's nothing special inside but they do have a good vegetarian selection which is not always easy to come across in the financial district. Tempura yams, tempura asparagus and tempura tofu rolls all for 11 bucks. The rolls are pretty big too and they included a salad for free. It was ready quickly and I'd get it again.
author: aaron f.

description:
Based on price, quality and speediness of service, this is the best Japanese lunch option in the financial, period.

My usuals are the udon, the rolls (heaven roll) and the donburi.
author: Brian S.

description:
I'd have to say that I come here only because it's the closest, edible japanese restaurant to my work place.  When I'm craving japanese food while I'm at work, this is the place I come to.  There food is decent.  My favorite is the salmon donburi.  

I usually don't order their sushi because personally I don't really like their sushi.  Their sushi is super tiny and tasteless.
author: Katniss B.

description:
i tend to eat here a lot as the options for somewhat healthy food round these parts is few and far between. it's a good lunch place. the food is pretty good. not amazing, but what do you expect for lunch at work if you can't Shell out 20 bucks a meal? 

the food gets 3 stars from me but the customer service gets 4. they are always really friendly and helpful. the woman that runs the front is great. a coworker and i just had our wires crossed and both ordered the same thing for each other as we miscommunicated on who was to do ze ordering. they were totally cool with it and took back one of the orders after it was made. on that and that alone i'll go back time and time again. good service is rare these days, especially from a quick lunch place.
author: Kate H.

description: I finally gave in and am now turned on by sushi and since this place is right behind the building i work in, it's perfect.  it's also cheap, fast and good, i love "double punch" and always order it.  8 pieces of salmon & tuna drizzled with tiny burstable eggs, peppers and spicy mayo.  Cost = seven bucks and some odd cents....
author: erica u.

description:
YUM!

I love this place. I spent a long time trying to find a good sushi place near my office and I finally found it when a friend took me here for lunch one time. So. Good. A wide variety of sushi dishes that they make right quick and are delicious.

Be warned: if you go between 12-1 this place is going to be packed to a level that boarders on the absurd. There are two registers you can order from so just hop in line, figure out what you want to have and they will crank you through there. I would reccomend one of the specials because this place is a tad overpriced (-1/2 star) and they are a good deal. Generally it's a big roll and a small roll and miso soup and a salad. Once you order they give you a number...if it's packed go and stand by the door and wait for them to seat you (this may not be explicitly apparent but it's what they expect you to do...I was pretty confused my first time). A waiter will rush by and get you seated somewhere pretty quick, but if it's just you (or just you and a friend) it's going to be at a table with another party (-1/2 star...I understand the need to get everyone seated but I'm just not a huge fan...this place should expand so all parties can have their own table!).

I usually take a late lunch and go around 1:30...not as crowded then by half. And again, it's the best sushi lunch spot I've found in the FiDi.
author: Valerie K.

description: Great place for lunch. Love their udon and sushi is not bad. I also like their beef terriyaki. Take  outs are available. Call ahead and they will have it for you.
author: Jay S.

description:
For the umpteenth time, I ordered via phone, was told it would take 10 minutes. I arrived at the appropriate time, saw my food sitting on the counter, paid, and still waited 10 minutes to receive my food. 

I specifically went after the lunch rush to ensure a quick transaction, and they clearly and intentionally delayed handing over my food. There were four counter employees milling about, two of which verified my name and order when I paid. None of them even attempted to look and see if my order was ready until they had served several other walk-in customers who arrived and ordered after me.

I work so close to this place, that my coworkers and I are practically the foundation of their business. They see us every week, and they clearly do not respect us or understand how much money we bring into their business. I just threw out their menu, and heartily discourage any and everyone from patronizing this restaurant.
author: Myss T.

description: It's not a bad place to have lunch in the financial district if you're craving for Japanese food. The price is affordable, and if you order hot food, it usually comes with salad and soup (which is usually filling and healthy). I usually order the daily special, but I like the unagi donburi (friday's special) the most ; or the nebayaki udon.
author: Full House C.

description: The place is usually packed at lunch, so this may work better as a to-go option. I've been going here for at least 3 years, about once every couple of months. Salmon teriyaki, their special handmade rolls, and the lunch special are usually very good. I like the fact that they have a free cup of tea available for takeout. While they are busy, the people at the register ROCK. Super-quick.
author: Stu U.

description: This is my favorite place to eat in the FiDi because: A. I'm obsessed with sushi, B. it's cheap (for sushi) and uber fresh, and C. it's right around the corner from my office. I come here about 2 times a week and I always get my food to go, but you can eat-in. If you're planning on eating there, it gets pretty crazy between 11:30-12:30 so it can be hard to find seating. They have awesome specials everyday, a few sushi ones and a non-sushi one. I have only had their sushi so I can't review any of the other food but I see a lot of people with Udon soup, bento boxes, and the teriyaki and donburi entrees. My favorite rolls are the spicy hamachi, spicy tuna, heaven roll, double punch, dragon roll, spicy CA roll, rock & roll, and the knock-out roll. I love to go on Mondays because they have the heaven roll special that day and it's only $9.99 for that plus 4 pieces of CA roll, miso soup and salad. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!
author: Amanda S.

description: Considering the Japanese food options in the area, this place is okay. It does the job when you need a sushi fix. It's crowded and hectic during lunch, and the female who usually works the counter is all about efficiency and getting people's orders and on to the next person. As soon as you had her your credit card, she's telling you where the pen is. The younger guy is very friendly. Considering all that's going on in there, they've never messed up an order.
author: redgirl v.

description: chicken udon! I am a fan! HUGE pieces of tender chicken that isn't overcooked.
author: T A.

description: quick bite for lunch here would be perfect except the bento boxes are deceiving.  in the picture above the cash register they show an actual bento box with rolls and deep fried veggies however without ordering them on the side you just get a plate of rice and meat.  salad and miso soup comes before the plate but they were mediocre.  if i worked around here i would definitely eat here but watch out for that deceiving menu.
author: Dee Y.

description: My favorite place for japanese lunch -- all the food is good.  I usually get the sushi combo (A or B), the spider roll or the udon -- yum!
author: M B.

description: One of my favorite lunch spots.  Reasonably priced, great sushi, very fast & friendly service.  Only thing I would not recommend on their menu is anything with beef...a bit too tough for my taste.
author: renee t.

description: Good sushi, convenient to my office. Best to call in take-out orders, as there can be a back up at lunchtime
author: Kimarie M.

description: sometimes i get sick of shelling out $7-9 for an okay sandwhich or salad. i'd rather get my money's worth on a bento box (your choice of teriyaki, chicken katsu, sushi, tempura that comes with salad), soup, and tea.  fast service as it is a lunch joint in the financial district - so you can't expect too much since it's not a regular japanese restaurant.  sushi portions are pretty small and not all that.  the bento boxes seem like a better deal if you want to get filled up for lunch.
author: ally o.

description: the california roll was really good, but the spicy tuna roll lacked flavor.  be sure you get here around 11:30 right before the big lunch rush! theres very little room to stand around and wait for your take out.  there are as many people dining as there are people waiting for their to-go bags. but the service is superfast and the food is fresh. an ideal spot for a casual lunch break.
author: Anthro Food E.

description: I like the pictorial menu, otherwise the list of items get very overwhelming and seemingly the same.  The daily lunch specials for $8-10 usually include a specialty roll, an additional roll, miso, and small salad.  It's not exceptional sushi, but I've also never had anything I didn't like here.
author: LT B.
